timeline.author: emmberk

timeline.bodyText: It's a pain to maintain two environments. Didn't think it was in-scope for this PR, but it made me wonder why we don't run these on top of the kernel
timeline.author: SmithJosh

timeline.bodyText: There was no change to the DDF JAXB schemas, but for some reason after upgrading JAXB, it started failing to unmarshall this request. I looked at the schema and the namespace here should be csw, so I think JAXB should have been failing on this before as well.
timeline.author: SmithJosh

timeline.bodyText:
The only code change for this PR 🎉
If this is null, we just return a new SecurityAssertionSaml instance. I'm not sure if that's what we actually want, as the code looks like we were not expecting the token store to be null. Would appreciate another set of eyes.
https://github.com/codice/ddf/blob/master/platform/security/pep/security-pep-interceptor/src/main/java/ddf/security/pep/interceptor/SecurityAssertionStore.java#L115
timeline.author: SmithJosh

replies.bodyText: It will work correctly the way it is and the PEP still fails closed as long as the token for the assertion is null, which it will be if you just create an empty SAML assertion. However, it might be more correct if we just return an exception if the token store is null or in the case where we might flow down to returning that empty SecurityAssertionSaml instance. I think all that empty instance does is trigger the error condition anyways, so we may as well just jump there. That way we can avoid someone changing the PEP in the future and this possibly failing open at some point.
replies.author: stustison

replies.bodyText: Ok thanks for confirming. I'm inclined to keep it as-is in that case since the PEP still denies access. I checked and the PEP has tests for null tokens and null assertions so that should raise some flags if it starts failing open.
replies.author: SmithJosh

timeline.message: DDF-6360 Switch to Jakarta JAXB dependencies
DDF-6360 Add javax.servlet-api to dependencyManagement in root pom
DDF-6360 Add Guava to dependencyManagment in root pom and upgrade to JSR305 3.0.2
DDF-6360 Match Guava versions to prevent uses constraint violations
Take 3 for the rest endpoint itest
